choices.D: Provide the employee with refresher training.
choices.C: Request an exception to the clear desk policy.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Recommend provision of secure document storage.

B is the corrective solution. Training is more of a follow-up action

Selected Answer: B
The most appropriate next step for the risk practitioner would be to recommend the provision of secure document storage. This addresses the violation of the clear desk policy by offering a solution that ensures sensitive documents are stored securely when not in use.

Options A and C are not the best immediate responses. Securely disposing of the documents (Option A) might not be necessary if the documents are still needed for work purposes, and requesting an exception to the clear desk policy (Option C) may not be the best course of action without exploring more secure storage options.

Option D, providing the employee with refresher training, could be part of the solution but may not be the most immediate and practical step to address the violation. Recommending secure document storage is a proactive measure to prevent future policy violations and promote a secure working environment.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the BEST way to ensure key risk indicators (KRIs) continue to help management make informed decisions?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The best way to ensure key risk indicators (KRIs) continue to help management make informed decisions is to align KRIs with risk events identified in the risk register.

Selected Answer: D
D. Define a mix of leading and lagging KRIs.
Leading indicators -> potential future events or changes in risk conditions, allowing proactive actions to be taken. 
Lagging indicators -> reflect historical performance and can provide valuable insights into the outcomes of past risk management efforts.
